verses.text: You should have given more honour to us, the elders of the whole church of Israel, both that he might be on terms of mutual affection with the children, and that among us he might be instructed in Jewish learning.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 31:5
verses.text: Joseph, on the other hand, said to him:  And is there any one who can keep this child, and teach him?  But if thou canst keep him and teach him, we by no means hinder him from being taught by thee those things which are learned by all.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 31:6
verses.text: And Jesus, having heard what Zachyas had said, answered and said unto him:  The precepts of the law which thou hast just spoken of, and all the things that thou hast named, must be kept by those who are instructed in human learning; but I am a stranger to your law-courts, because I have no father after the flesh.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 31:7
verses.text: Thou who readest the law, and art learned in it, abidest in the law; but I was before the law.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 31:8
verses.text: But since thou thinkest that no one is equal to thee in learning, thou shalt be taught by me, that no other can teach anything but those things which thou hast named.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 31:9
verses.text: But he alone can who is worthy.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 31:10
verses.text: For when I shall be exalted on earth, I will cause to cease all mention of your genealogy.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 31:11
verses.text: For thou knowest not when thou wast born:  I alone know when you were born, and how long your life on earth will be.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 31:12
verses.text: Then all who heard these words were struck with astonishment, and cried out:  Oh! oh! oh! this marvellously great and wonderful mystery.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 31:13
verses.text: Never have we heard the like!  Never has it been heard from any one else, nor has it been said or at any time heard by the prophets, or the Pharisees, or the scribes.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 31:14
verses.text: We know whence he is sprung, and he is scarcely five years old; and whence does he speak these words?  The Pharisees answered:  We have never heard such words spoken by any other child so young.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 31:15
verses.text: And Jesus answered and said unto them:  At this do ye wonder, that such things are said by a child?  Why, then, do ye not believe me in those things which I have said to you?  And you all wonder because I said to you that I know when you were born.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 31:16
verses.text: I will tell you greater things, that you may wonder more.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 31:17
verses.text: I have seen Abraham, whom you call your father, and have spoken with him; and he has seen me.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 31:18
verses.text: And when they heard this they held their tongues, nor did any of them dare to speak.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 31:19
verses.text: And Jesus said to them:  I have been among you with children, and you have not known me; I have spoken to you as to wise men, and you have not understood my words; because you are younger than I am, and of little faith.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:1
verses.text: Chapter.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:2
verses.text: A second time the master Zachyas, doctor of the law, said to Joseph and Mary:  Give me the boy, and I shall hand him over to master Levi, who shall teach him his letters and instruct him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:3
verses.text: Then Joseph and Mary, soothing Jesus, took Him to the schools, that He might be taught His letters by old Levi.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:4
verses.text: And as soon as He went in He held His tongue.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:5
verses.text: And the master Levi said one letter to Jesus, and, beginning from the first letter Aleph, said to Him:  Answer.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:6
verses.text: But Jesus was silent, and answered nothing.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:7
verses.text: Wherefore the preceptor Levi was angry, and seized his storax-tree rod, and struck Him on the head.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:8
verses.text: And Jesus said to the teacher Levi:  Why dost thou strike me?  Thou shalt know in truth, that He who is struck can teach him who strikes Him more than He can be taught by him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:9
verses.text: For I can teach you those very things that you are saying.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:10
verses.text: But all these are blind who speak and hear, like sounding brass or tinkling cymbal, in which there is no perception of those things which are meant by their sound.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:11
verses.text: And Jesus in addition said to Zachyas:  Every letter from Aleph even to Thet is known by its arrangement.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:12
verses.text: Say thou first, therefore, what Thet is, and I will tell thee what Aleph is.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:13
verses.text: And again Jesus said to them:  Those who do not know Aleph, how can they say Thet, the hypocrites?  Tell me what the first one, Aleph, is; and I shall then believe you when you have said Beth.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:14
verses.text: And Jesus began to ask the names of the letters one by one, and said:  Let the master of the law tell us what the first letter is, or why it has many triangles, gradate, subacute, mediate, obduced, produced, erect, prostrate, curvistrate.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:15
verses.text: And when Levi heard this, he was thunderstruck at such an arrangement of the names of the letters.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:16
verses.text: Then he began in the hearing of all to cry out, and say:  Ought such a one to live on the earth?  Yea, he ought to be hung on the great cross.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:17
verses.text: For he can put out fire, and make sport of other modes of punishment.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:18
verses.text: I think that he lived before the flood, and was born before the deluge.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:19
verses.text: For what womb bore him? or what mother brought him forth? or what breasts gave him suck?  I flee before him; I am not able to withstand the words from his mouth, but my heart is astounded to hear such words.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:20
verses.text: I do not think that any man can understand what he says, except God were with him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:21
verses.text: Now I, unfortunate wretch, have given myself up to be a laughing-stock to him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:22
verses.text: For when I thought I had a scholar, I, not knowing him, have found my master.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:23
verses.text: What shall I say?  I cannot withstand the words of this child:  I shall now flee from this town, because I cannot understand them.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:24
verses.text: An old man like me has been beaten by a boy, because I can find neither beginning nor end of what he says.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:25
verses.text: For it is no easy matter to find a beginning of himself.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:26
verses.text: I tell you of a certainty, I am not lying, that to my eyes the proceedings of this boy, the commencement of his conversation, and the upshot of his intention, seem to have nothing in common with mortal man.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:27
verses.text: Here then I do not know whether he be a wizard or a god; or at least an angel of God speaks in him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:28
verses.text: Whence he is, or where he comes from, or who he will turn out to be, I know not.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:29
verses.text: Then Jesus, smiling at him with a joyful countenance, said in a commanding voice to all the sons of Israel standing by and hearing:  Let the unfruitful bring forth fruit, and the blind see, and the lame walk right, and the poor enjoy the good things of this life, and the dead live, that each may return to his original state, and abide in Him who is the root of life and of perpetual sweetness.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:30
verses.text: And when the child Jesus had said this, forthwith all who had fallen under malignant diseases were restored.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 32:31
verses.text: And they did not dare to say anything more to Him, or to hear anything from Him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 33:1
verses.text: Chapter.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 33:2
verses.text: After these things, Joseph and Mary departed thence with Jesus into the city of Nazareth; and He remained there with His parents.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 33:3
verses.text: And on the first of the week, when Jesus was playing with the children on the roof of a certain house, it happened that one of the children pushed another down from the roof to the ground, and he was killed.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 33:4
verses.text: And the parents of the dead boy, who had not seen this, cried out against Joseph and Mary, saying:  Your son has thrown our son down to the ground, and he is dead.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 33:5
verses.text: But Jesus was silent, and answered them nothing.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 33:6
verses.text: And Joseph and Mary came in haste to Jesus; and His mother asked Him, saying:  My lord, tell me if thou didst throw him down.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 33:7
verses.text: And immediately Jesus went down from the roof to the ground, and called the boy by his name, Zeno.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 33:8
verses.text: And he answered Him:  My lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 33:9
verses.text: And Jesus said to him:  Was it I that threw thee down from the roof to the ground?  And he said:  No, my lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 33:10
verses.text: And the parents of the boy who had been dead wondered, and honoured Jesus for the miracle that had been wrought.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 33:11
verses.text: And Joseph and Mary departed thence with Jesus to Jericho.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 34:1
verses.text: Chapter.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 34:2
verses.text: Now Jesus was six years old, and His mother sent Him with a pitcher to the fountain to draw water with the children.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 34:3
verses.text: And it came to pass, after He had drawn the water, that one of the children came against Him, and struck the pitcher, and broke it.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 34:4
verses.text: But Jesus stretched out the cloak which He had on, and took up in His cloak as much water as there had been in the pitcher, and carried it to His mother.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 34:5
verses.text: And when she saw it she wondered, and reflected within herself, and laid up all these things in her heart.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 35:1
verses.text: Chapter.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 35:2
verses.text: Again, on a certain day, He went forth into the field, and took a little wheat from His mother's barn, and sowed it Himself.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 35:3
verses.text: And it sprang up, and grew, and multiplied exceedingly.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 35:4
verses.text: And at last it came to pass that He Himself reaped it, and gathered as the produce of it three kors, and gave it to His numerous acquaintances.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 36:1
verses.text: Chapter.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 36:2
verses.text: There is a road going out of Jericho and leading to the river Jordan, to the place where the children of Israel crossed:  and there the ark of the covenant is said to have rested.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 36:3
verses.text: And Jesus was eight years old, and He went out of Jericho, and went towards the Jordan.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 36:4
verses.text: And there was beside the road, near the bank of the Jordan, a cave where a lioness was nursing her cubs; and no one was safe to walk that way.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 36:5
verses.text: Jesus then, coming from Jericho, and knowing that in that cave the lioness had brought forth her young, went into it in the sight of all.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 36:6
verses.text: And when the lions saw Jesus, they ran to meet Him, and adored Him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 36:7
verses.text: And Jesus was sitting in the cavern, and the lion's cubs ran hither and thither round His feet, fawning upon Him, and sporting.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 36:8
verses.text: And the older lions, with their heads bowed down, stood at a distance, and adored Him, and fawned upon Him with their tails.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 36:9
verses.text: Then the people who were standing afar off, not seeing Jesus, said:  Unless he or his parents had committed grievous sins, he would not of his own accord have offered himself up to the lions.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 36:10
verses.text: And when the people were thus reflecting within themselves, and were lying under great sorrow, behold, on a sudden, in the sight of the people, Jesus came out of the cave, and the lions went before Him, and the lion's cubs played with each other before His feet.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 36:11
verses.text: And the parents of Jesus stood afar off, with their heads bowed down, and watched; likewise also the people stood at a distance, on account of the lions; for they did not dare to come close to them.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 36:12
verses.text: Then Jesus began to say to the people:  How much better are the beasts than you, seeing that they recognise their Lord, and glorify Him; while you men, who have been made after the image and likeness of God, do not know Him!  Beasts know me, and are tame; men see me, and do not acknowledge me.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 37:1
verses.text: Chapter.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 37:2
verses.text: After these things Jesus crossed the Jordan, in the sight of them all, with the lions; and the water of the Jordan was divided on the right hand and on the left.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 37:3
verses.text: Then He said to the lions, in the hearing of all:  Go in peace, and hurt no one; but neither let man injure you, until you return to the place whence you have come forth.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 37:4
verses.text: And they, bidding Him farewell, not only with their gestures but with their voices, went to their own place.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 37:5
verses.text: But Jesus returned to His mother.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 38:1
verses.text: Chapter.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 38:2
verses.text: Now Joseph was a carpenter, and used to make nothing else of wood but ox-yokes, and ploughs, and implements of husbandry, and wooden beds.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 38:3
verses.text: And it came to pass that a certain young man ordered him to make for him a couch six cubits long.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 38:4
verses.text: And Joseph commanded his servant to cut the wood with an iron saw, according to the measure which he had sent.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 38:5
verses.text: But he did not keep to the prescribed measure, but made one piece of wood shorter than the other.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 38:6
verses.text: And Joseph was in perplexity, and began to consider what he was to do about this.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 38:7
verses.text: And when Jesus saw him in this state of cogitation, seeing that it was a matter of impossibility to him, He addresses him with words of comfort, saying:  Come, let us take hold of the ends of the pieces of wood, and let us put them together, end to end, and let us fit them exactly to each other, and draw to us, for we shall be able to make them equal.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 38:8
verses.text: Then Joseph did what he was bid, for he knew that He could do whatever He wished.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 38:9
verses.text: And Joseph took hold of the ends of the pieces of wood, and brought them together against the wall next himself, and Jesus took hold of the other ends of the pieces of wood, and drew the shorter piece to Him, and made it of the same length as the longer one.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 38:10
verses.text: And He said to Joseph:  Go and work, and do what thou hast promised to do.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 38:11
verses.text: And Joseph did what he had promised.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 39:1
verses.text: Chapter.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 39:2
verses.text: And it came to pass a second time, that Joseph and Mary were asked by the people that Jesus should be taught His letters in school.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 39:3
verses.text: They did not refuse to do so; and according to the commandment of the elders, they took Him to a master to be instructed in human learning.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 39:4
verses.text: Then the master began to teach Him in an imperious tone, saying:  Say Alpha.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 39:5
verses.text: And Jesus said to him:  Do thou tell me first what Betha is, and I will tell thee what Alpha is.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 39:6
verses.text: And upon this the master got angry and struck Jesus; and no sooner had he struck Him, than he fell down dead.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 39:7
verses.text: And Jesus went home again to His mother.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 39:8
verses.text: And Joseph, being afraid, called Mary to him, and said to her:  Know of a surety that my soul is sorrowful even unto death on account of this child.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 39:9
verses.text: For it is very likely that at some time or other some one will strike him in malice, and he will die.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 39:10
verses.text: But Mary answered and said:  O man of God! do not believe that this is possible.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 39:11
verses.text: You may believe to a certainty that He who has sent him to be born among men will Himself guard him from all mischief, and will in His own name preserve him from evil.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 40:1
verses.text: Chapter.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 40:2
verses.text: Again the Jews asked Mary and Joseph a third time to coax Him to go to another master to learn.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 40:3
verses.text: And Joseph and Mary, fearing the people, and the overbearing of the princes, and the threats of the priests, led Him again to school, knowing that He could learn nothing from man, because He had perfect knowledge from God only.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 40:4
verses.text: And when Jesus had entered the school, led by the Holy Spirit, He took the book out of the hand of the master who was teaching the law, and in the sight and hearing of all the people began to read, not indeed what was written in their book; but He spoke in the Spirit of the living God, as if a stream of water were gushing forth from a living fountain, and the fountain remained always full.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 40:5
verses.text: And with such power He taught the people the great things of the living God, that the master himself fell to the ground and adored Him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 40:6
verses.text: And the heart of the people who sat and heard Him saying such things was turned into astonishment.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 40:7
verses.text: And when Joseph heard of this, he came running to Jesus, fearing that the master himself was dead.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 40:8
verses.text: And when the master saw him, he said to him:  Thou hast given me not a scholar, but a master; and who can withstand his words?  Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by the Psalmist:  The river of God is full of water:  Thou hast prepared them corn, for so is the provision for it.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 41:1
verses.text: Chapter.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 41:2
verses.text: After these things Joseph departed thence with Mary and Jesus to go into Capernaum by the sea-shore, on account of the malice of his adversaries.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 41:3
verses.text: And when Jesus was living in Capernaum, there was in the city a man named Joseph, exceedingly rich.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 41:4
verses.text: But he had wasted away under his infirmity, and died, and was lying dead in his couch.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 41:5
verses.text: And when Jesus heard them in the city mourning, and weeping, and lamenting over the dead man, He said to Joseph:  Why dost thou not afford the benefit of thy favour to this man, seeing that he is called by thy name?  And Joseph answered him:  How have I any power or ability to afford him a benefit?  And Jesus said to him:  Take the handkerchief which is upon thy head, and go and put it on the face of the dead man, and say to him:  Christ heal thee; and immediately the dead man will be healed, and will rise from his couch.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 41:6
verses.text: And when Joseph heard this, he went away at the command of Jesus, and ran, and entered the house of the dead man, and put the handkerchief which he was wearing on his head upon the face of him who was lying in the couch, and said:  Jesus heal thee.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 41:7
verses.text: And forthwith the dead man rose from his bed, and asked who Jesus was.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 42:1
verses.text: Chapter.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 42:2
verses.text: And they went away from Capernaum into the city which is called Bethlehem; and Joseph lived with Mary in his own house, and Jesus with them.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 42:3
verses.text: And on a certain day Joseph called to him his first-born son James, and sent him into the vegetable garden to gather vegetables for the purpose of making broth.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 42:4
verses.text: And Jesus followed His brother James into the garden; but Joseph and Mary did not know this.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 42:5
verses.text: And while James was collecting the vegetables, a viper suddenly came out of a hole and struck his hand, and he began to cry out from excessive pain.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 42:6
verses.text: And, becoming exhausted, he said, with a bitter cry:  Alas! alas! an accursed viper has struck my hand.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 42:7
verses.text: And Jesus, who was standing opposite to him, at the bitter cry ran up to James, and took hold of his hand; and all that He did was to blow on the hand of James, and cool it:  and immediately James was healed, and the serpent died.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 42:8
verses.text: And Joseph and Mary did not know what had been done; but at the cry of James, and the command of Jesus, they ran to the garden, and found the serpent already dead, and James quite cured.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 43:1
verses.text: Chapter.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 43:2
verses.text: And Joseph having come to a feast with his sons, James, Joseph, and Judah, and Simeon and his two daughters, Jesus met them, with Mary His mother, along with her sister Mary of Cleophas, whom the Lord God had given to her father Cleophas and her mother Anna, because they had offered Mary the mother of Jesus to the Lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 43:3
verses.text: And she was called by the same name, Mary, for the consolation of her parents.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 43:4
verses.text: And when they had come together, Jesus sanctified and blessed them, and He was the first to begin to eat and drink; for none of them dared to eat or drink, or to sit at table, or to break bread, until He had sanctified them, and first done so.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 43:5
verses.text: And if He happened to be absent, they used to wait until He should do this.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 43:6
verses.text: And when He did not wish to come for refreshment, neither Joseph nor Mary, nor the sons of Joseph, His brothers, came.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 43:7
verses.text: And, indeed, these brothers, keeping His life as a lamp before their eyes, observed Him, and feared Him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 43:8
verses.text: And when Jesus slept, whether by day or by night, the brightness of God shone upon Him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 43:9
verses.text: To whom be all praise and glory for ever and ever.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew 43:10
verses.text: Amen, amen.
